documentation.text:
@notice getHeirs - get the heir list as a bytes32 array
@return heirs (bytes32[MAX_HEIRS])

returns.res: (uint40) - time left in seconds untill the backup is enabled or 0 if the time has passed
(uint40) - time left in seconds untill the inheritance is enabled or 0 if the time has passed

params.timeout: (type uint32) - timeout in seconds  Requirements: 1. must enter a wallet address 2. owner wallet address must be different then the backup wallet address Caution: this operation will override the previous backup wallet

setHeirs(address[],uint16[]).details: the function emits an event called InheritanceHeirsChanged with the new heirs wallets and funds

params.bps: - uint16[] - an array of funds for each heir (bps => 0.01%)
params.wallets: - address payable[] - an array of wallets, one for each heir

params.timeout: (uint32) - hold the block timeStamp and the timeout is set from that time

accept().notice: sets the status of the backup to registered if the status was pending

activateBackup().notice: activates backup wallet conditions: 1. backup is enabled 2. backup wallet needs to be set 3. backup time that was set is now 0

activateInheritance().notice: activateInheritance function check if all the necessary measures have been fufilled and then sends the funds defined to the heirs wallets

claimOwnership().notice: once a backup wallet was activated the ownership of the original wallet needs to be claimed by the owner of the backup wallet restrictions: 1. only the backup wallet owner can claim the original wallet 2. backup status needs to be active

clearInheritance().notice: clearInheritance the function removes the heir list asociated with a apecific wallet resets the timeOut and unactivates the inharitance process from the wallet owner

enable().notice: sets the status of the backup to be enabled can be triggered by the owner or by the backup

getBackupTimeLeft().notice: checks the time left until the backup can be activated

getHeirs().notice: getHeirs - get the heir list as a bytes32 array

getInheritanceTimeLeft().notice: getInheritanceTimeLeft - checks the time left until the inheritance can be activated

getTotalBPS().notice: getTotalBPS - calculates and returns the total bps (1 bps = 0.01%) sets to be sent once the inheritance will take effect

reclaimOwnership().notice: the owner that created the backup wallet can reclaim the account back restrictions: 1. only the original wallet owner can reclaim his original wallet 2. backup status needs to be active

setBackup(address,uint32).notice: this function sets the backup wallet to a specific activeOwner

setHeirs(address[],uint16[]).notice: setHeir - as the name suggests, the function sets the heirs to a specific wallet

setInheritance(uint32).notice: setInheritance the function sets the time conditions for the inheritance

userdoc.notice: Heritable contract intreduces a way to set up heirs to the  funds in a specific wallet.  Features: 1. the contract supports up to 8 heirs 2. abillity to set a time (in seconds) that the funds will be sent to the heirs.
